name: UpdateGithubLabel
description:
Update a label on a GitHub repository.

Use this tool to update a label in a specified GitHub repository. It is useful when label details need modification, such as changing the name or color.

parameters.name: repository_owner
parameters.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repository_name
parameters.description: The name of the repository to update the label in. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: current_label_name
parameters.description: The current name of the label to be updated. It should match exactly the label's existing name.

parameters.name: label_color_hex_code
parameters.description: The hexadecimal color code for the label, excluding the leading `#`.

value_schema.description: The [hexadecimal color code](http://www.color-hex.com/) for the label, without the leading `#`.

parameters.name: label_description
parameters.description: A short description of the label, limited to 100 characters or fewer.

value_schema.description: A short description of the label. Must be 100 characters or fewer.

parameters.name: new_label_name
parameters.description: The updated label name for the GitHub label. Emojis can be embedded using native or colon-style markup (e.g., :strawberry:). For available emojis, refer to the Emoji cheat sheet.

value_schema.description: The new name of the label. Emoji can be added to label names, using either native emoji or colon-style markup. For example, typing `:strawberry:` will render the emoji ![:strawberry:](https://github.githubassets.com/images/icons/emoji/unicode/1f353.png ":strawberry:"). For a full list of available emoji and codes, see "[Emoji cheat sheet](https://github.com/ikatyang/emoji-cheat-sheet)."

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the GitHub API.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repo
parameters.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: The [hexadecimal color code](http://www.color-hex.com/) for the label, without the leading `#`.

value_schema.description: The [hexadecimal color code](http://www.color-hex.com/) for the label, without the leading `#`.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: A short description of the label. Must be 100 characters or fewer.

value_schema.description: A short description of the label. Must be 100 characters or fewer.

parameters.name: new_name
parameters.description: The new name of the label. Emoji can be added to label names, using either native emoji or colon-style markup. For example, typing `:strawberry:` will render the emoji ![:strawberry:](https://github.githubassets.com/images/icons/emoji/unicode/1f353.png ":strawberry:"). For a full list of available emoji and codes, see "[Emoji cheat sheet](https://github.com/ikatyang/emoji-cheat-sheet)."

value_schema.description: The new name of the label. Emoji can be added to label names, using either native emoji or colon-style markup. For example, typing `:strawberry:` will render the emoji ![:strawberry:](https://github.githubassets.com/images/icons/emoji/unicode/1f353.png ":strawberry:"). For a full list of available emoji and codes, see "[Emoji cheat sheet](https://github.com/ikatyang/emoji-cheat-sheet)."

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
